unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Chi-Square Goodness of Fit: Voter Population
question_text: A politician projects that the population of voters who support him will be evenly divided between younger voters, middle-aged voters, and older voters.  The table below shows the distribution of a  random sample of 120 of the politician's supporters. Younger Voters Middle-aged Voters Older Voters 27 34 59 What is the value of the ${ \chi  }^{ 2 }$ statistic for the goodness of fit test on these data?
